Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay”
Reviews.Author: Brandon K
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location for Oriole Park at Camden Yards, or the Baltimore Ravens Stadium. The Orioles brought home a win on opening day. The staff were all nice and helpful and gave me anything i needed. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheerleading Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: A plesant stay even with a hotel full of cheerleaders, a group which my family and I were a part. Our room was comfortable, and I found the staff more than accomodating. The maid service was somewhat lacking (needed to request toilet paper and clean towles from the front desk), however this was immediately taken care of when brought to the managements attention. Lobby and halls were always clean. Some stains on room furniture but again, this is a hotel and furniture can't be replaced everytime someone has a spill. Walking distance to all the major attractions of the harbor, convention center, and camden yards. Overall a comfortable and relaxing stay at a reasonable price for the area.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel In the Inner Harbor Baltimore - With One Main Exception”
Reviews.Author: Al M
Reviews.Content: I am extremely disappointed with the Inner Harbor Holiday Inn, as it was extremely subpar when compared the other hotels I have stayed in for work in the Inner Harbor (Marriot, Renaissance, and others). Here is a list of the problems: - The hotel (outside of the first floor lobby and bar) looks generally uncared for; doors and hallways have chipped paint, there are stains on the hallway carpets, it looks dingy and dirty, etc. - The water changed from scalding to freezing at times. This suggests a problem with the water heater. - There was a sewer gas smell emanating from the tub/toilet. - There was what appeared to be black mold in the bathroom ceiling (health hazard) - The room generally had a musty smell. - The tub flooded when being used for more than 2 or 3 minutes. Maintenance fixed it. - My toilet flushing mechanism broke (apparently while I was at work). Maintenance fixed it, but it never worked very well after that. - There were stains all over my room and on the chairs. - The bed was horribly uncomfortable. - The temp control was bad, the AC would freeze the whole room when on because the system was trying to drop the temperature one degree. - The cleaning staff did not always replace toilet paper or soap - The cleaning staff turned off my temp control when I went to DC for a weekend. They should not mess with the temperature when it is obvious that someone is still staying in the room (my suitcases and clothes were clearly visible). I set it at 74 degrees on Friday with the thermostat set to “on” and returned to my room to be 80+ degrees with the thermostat set to “off” when I returned on Sunday. This really irked me; my employer paid for the room on my behalf (stayed there for over a month), therefore, I should be able to set the thermostat to any temperature I want and the room should be the same when I return. This shows that hotel management is cheap and that they instruct employees to try and save money at the occupant’s expense. This is pennywise but pound foolish. - There are no garbage cans in the hallway by the elevators. Try eating a can of tuna and then trying to locate a garbage can to dispose of it so that your whole room doesn’t smell like tuna. - The “high speed” internet was painfully slow. - My jacket disappeared from the dining room. I forgot it in the hotel dining room and realized the next morning. I looked for it and asked staff if they found it the next morning, however, it was gone. It was my fault for forgetting the jacket, but usually staff sees that a guest left something behind, then they give it to the front desk. - Staff does not pick up the dry cleaning bag when you leave it in your room. Staff did not get dry cleaning back on time (supposed to be next day, but it was back in two and sometimes three days). They never put it in your room (like at most hotels). They do not replace the back and receipt when you use the one in your room. - The pool closes at noon on Sundays. Why have a pool if guests who are staying long term cannot even use it on one of their two non-work days per week? - Much of the cardio equipment in the “gym” is damaged. Weights mysteriously disappeared while we were staying there. I do not usually complain about these things, rather, I take them in stride. However, I feel that it is necessary to let people know how bad the Holiday Inn is. I have stayed at several of the Marriot hotels here in Baltimore for work, including the Renaissance, which was phenomenal (they took care of me even after my fridge exploded, leaking freon into my room). I stayed at the Holiday Inn two years ago and it was not nice then, but it has become horrible since. I do not ever want to stay at this hotel again. The Positives: 1) The front desk staff is very friendly 2) Michael the bartender is a phenomenal bartender, entertainer, and all around person. I spent many a night during my 32+ days at the hotel bar to break up the monotony of being in my room. The other bartender is subpar and square. Michael is funny, he always had a joke to cheer me up after long hours at work. He is extremely intelligent and a good conversationalist, we had some great discussions. He is a spectacular bartender, my drinks were always made right, were cold, and I never had to wait to get one (even when the bar was full). He made great suggestions about where to go, where to eat, and what to avoid in Baltimore. He is a great spokesman for the hotel and the city. If it wasn’t for Mike, I don’t know how I would have been able to deal with staying in the hotel. Kudos, thank you for everything Mike; who’s better than you! Note to hotel staff: Give the guy a raise because he is the best bartender ever and makes your hotel bearable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to baseball field.”
Reviews.Author: Loveroadtrip
Reviews.Content: It is our second visit to this hotel. We love the proximity to the Orioles park. It is walking distance to the Inner Harbor. Good service and value.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn in Baltimore a rare gem!”
Reviews.Author: rileyboy10
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay here. Was not expecting much since more than one review described it as" just an old chain hotel reasonably priced." Not a fair comment really since the Hotel decor appears recently updated, clean lobby and nice rooms. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Great location, walking distance to popular attractions and harborfront. Hotel truly was nicer than expected! We went to Camden Yards to see a ballgame. An announcement was made several times during the game that the Orioles want fans to be happy with their experience. They mean it-good food, reasonable priced seats, nice fans and good fun! Yankee fan but cheered for the Orioles at times. (I was that impressed with the city of Baltimore)

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL NICER PEOPLE”
Reviews.Author: theAdog56
Reviews.Content: after coming off poor treatment at another hotel, HI does it right here. Simple things matter: a smile when they greet you, a laugh at a not so good joke, and well, doing what they say they do: hosting you and your car with a warmth that this hotel chain often and in fact most times exudes, no matter the location. As a business traveller, this is the hotel for me on my visits to Baltimore. Only suggestion:they let you know the options for breakfast-but no big deal. I still will come back.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Adams Basin, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally a 3 minute walk to Camden Yards which was fantastic. There are also several small restaurants within walking distance. The harbor was about a 7 minute walk but still not bad. The hotel is okay, beds were fine, I thought it could use some upgrading as the hallways looked "tired" worn carpet, etc. but all in all it was a good hotel for a one or two night stay especially if you are going to the ballgame.

Reviews.Title: “The Holiday Inn Inner Harbor is a Homerun!”
Reviews.Author: johngnewyorkcity
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed at the Holiday Inn Inner Harbor and it was terrific. The Location is absolutely fantastic and within a short walk of almost everything in the Inner Harbor area. We had tickets to the baseball game and you could actually see the inside of the stadium from the room. The room itself was really nice and very clean. The bedding was in great shape and the entire room was spotless. Everything in the room also worked perfectly including the wireless high speed connection so was able to use my IPAD. Service was great and the Front Desk very helpful in assiting us with dining suggestions as well as being very accommodating. Loved the coffe shop, Dotti's, right off the lobby...perfect start to the morning....The Holiday Inn Inner Harbor was a homerun in our book. JohnNYC

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Seanwhit
Reviews.Content: The staff was very attentive and polite. My needs were adresses as soon as I had any concerns. Would recomend this hotel to anyone coming to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: GramaJo
Reviews.Content: Attended our granddaughter's volleyball tournament at the Baltimore Convention Center -- it was a very convenient walking distance. For the most part, this was a good hotel -- only downside was on the day prior to our departure, maid did not get to our room until 3 P.M. when we were returning to our room for the day. We discovered that she neglected to leave cups for coffee maker for following morning so we contacted Front Desk -- they took care of it pretty quickly and seemed to be very attentive to our needs,

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matt S
Reviews.Content: The breakfast buffet is fantastic. The heated pool and sauna is great after a long workout in the great health club.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Joe S
Reviews.Content: Stayed in town for a week first at Hilton and then at the Holiday Inn. Hilton staff is not even a comparison to the Holiday Inn staff. Best staff ever encounter especially the security staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Bernhard K
Reviews.Content: Just came back from my business trip in Baltimore. I spend 3 nights at the HolidayInn. My room was clean and had the typical Holiday Inn look, all you need when you are on a business trip. Internet worked great and there are plenty of outlets in the room. I had some initial issues with my room, due to noise from the street. The hotel was packed due to a convention nearby, but they moved me as soon as they had another room ready. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. From the front desk person to the waiter at the breakfast table. For example: My waiter noticed I was in a hurry during breakfast, without asking for it he brought me a paper cup to take my coffee with me. That's what I call pro-active and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not again.”
Reviews.Author: solo40Nigeria
Reviews.Content: Shared the room with a friend and was most uncomfortable. It was tight and untidy. We actually had a pair of shoes from previous guest in the room. The west wing had no life in it. No reception or lobby space.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: pilarv1
Reviews.Content: Clean and big rooms. Close to the convention center and aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and safe...sadly, that's the only value.”
Reviews.Author: Jerseybob175
Reviews.Content: Located just blocks from Baltimore's famous inner harbor, Camden yards and the ball fields and right next to the light rail. Found this hotel on the web with a great rate. I will say that the front desk, house keeping, pool guard and bellman could not be any nicer or more helpful. Our room on the eighth floor was very clean, bright and well layout with two queen beds, sitting chair, desk chair with work area and a large LCD flat screen. That is where the good stuff ends. I think charging $23. to park as a guest when the public parking in the next lot was cheaper by far is just a rip off. Two cars, $46.. really? ugh. The beds in the room had a formed "v" in the matresses, not great for sleeping. 4 pillows on the bed, two firm, two soft, nice? sort of. They are only 1/2 pillows. Rollover in the night, you roll off the pillow.not so nice. The bath shower diverter was not working properly. The flow/volume of water coming out of the shower head was completely sub-standard. The LCD TV displayed only a few number of channels and displayed very poor viewing quality, It was a very nice, name brand TV and the worst picture from what appeared to be poor reception or bad hook ups. The pool is heated and indoors. Thats the good news. The bad news is the level of chlorine in the pool room was so high, it burned our throats. There is no reason for that high of a chlorine level in the pool room air, No pool for us. Morning brought no local newspaper to the room door and according to the front desk , none were available anywhere in the hotel. Upon leaving the room, we had to wait quite about 5-10 minutes for an elevator that had room for us. Only three elevators for guests and at peak times, they filled up pretty quick. We had fresh coffee and a muffin in the lobby coffee shop. I will say it safe and clean and fine for an over night stay with no plans to relax by the pool or in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: GleefulTraveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice before, and this site continues to live up to past experiences. The room was clean, well appointed, and well kept. Bed was comfortable. I slept well. I only ate in the restaurant once. The menu was a tad short, but the food was good and the staff very friendly. Prices were average for the area. I parked right next to the hotel. Very convenient, and, for the city, not horribly pricy. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Michael the Bartender Makes This Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Norm F
Reviews.Content: My family and I were in town due to a medical emergency with my mother at the University of Maryland. We decided to get an adult beverage at the bar and met Michael. This guy was a breath of fresh air, especially under the circumstances we were facing. He treated us like an old neighborhood friend, told some jokes and was just all around a nice, fun guy. He made us laugh and took our minds away from the circumstances which was sorely needed. The hotel itself was nice, quiet and clean. It was convenient to all major points at the Inner Harbor. The staff was friendly and accommodating. If you go - tell Michael to tell you a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty outdated Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: anonymous176
Reviews.Content: When I first walked in to the lobby i was pretty excited. The lobby looked really modern. When we checked in we were sent to the west tower. We had to walk outside (it was covered) to another building. This building looked a little scary. The elevators were terrifyingly old. The rooms were disgusting. I asked for a non-smoking room, but the room smelled like a smoke shop. The shower had what looked like a blood stain the size of a basketball in it. I found used forks, knives and plates around the room. Someone i was staying with found used contraception in their room and a wallet. We complained to the front desk, but they didn't seem the least bit interested. (funny story, the front desk tried to identify the person who the wallet belonged to, the ID was of someone who lived across town, but no one by that name or address checked into that hotel, we can only guess what they were doing). That was the bad. The hotel's location was excellent only a little more than a block from the convention center. Also the restaurant in the hotel wasn't bad.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Business Services”
Reviews.Author: Basya J
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for business, usually at least one week in every month. From check in to check out the entire staff was very welcoming, helpful, and informative.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Hot Springs Village, Arkansas, United States
Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Inner Haarbor review.”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: the hotel staff was very responsive and helpful to every request each of us made. outstanding staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Go for value:”
Reviews.Author: Yamhillbilly
Reviews.Content: Great location (Inner Harbor, very close to light rail). As with many other Holiday Inn locations, it's an aging facility that has had a "somewhat remodel". Meaning that furnishings, bathroom fixtures etc. have been upgraded, but things like the hallways still feeling stuffy, or paint job details in the rooms not always up to such a high grade. But certainly livable, and I'm certainly happy with what I got for what I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great People”
Reviews.Author: aismith
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was average, but just what you'd expect at this level. Room and public areas were clean. We stayed over night while attending an event at the First Mariner Arena, which is directly catty-corner to the hotel; very convenient. Due to inclement weather we chose to eat at the hotel restaurant. One of the reasons we stayed here was so we could park the car and not have to drive anywhere in the city. The weather changed our plans for walking around to find a restaurant in the area. We were a little skeptical at first; the dining area is nice, but set up in some kind of retro 70's colors and decor. We were also the only people in there on a Saturday night, which gave us pause. Luckily, the staff couldn't have been any nicer and accommodating. The food was very well prepared and delicious, and the prices were great for downtown Baltimore. Our breakfast the next day was just as welcoming. Staff attending us for the breakfast buffet couldn't have been more inviting, courteous, and "down to earth" friendly. It really made for a pleasant experience, and something you don't find alot anymore in establishments in large cities.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Inner Harbor
HotelInfo.Address: 301 W. Lombard Street, Baltimore, MD 21201
